Subjective: Headache, 2 months, worsening; right-sided, sometimes bilateral; nausea, no vomiting; glare in vision; prefers dark room; no fever, no cough, no shortness of breath; occasional alcohol use, no smoking, no drugs; student, studying medicine; exercises regularly; family history of migraines and cluster headaches; Request: Wants to know cause and best course of action.
Objective: BP 120/80; pulse 50/min; cranial nerves intact; fingertip-nose test good; arm and leg strength good; Romberg's normal; gait slightly off.
Assessment: Probable migraine; ruled out cluster headache.
Plan: • Read about migraines on thuisarts.nl; • Start pain relief (paracetamol, ibuprofen) at symptom onset; • Keep headache diary to track patterns and triggers; • Follow-up in 4 weeks; • Return sooner if symptoms worsen or change.
